definitions: professional who specializes in educational theory and methods
examples: The educationalist proposed innovative teaching strategies for diverse learners
Several educationalists criticized the standardized testing approach nationwide

definitions: person who advocates for educational reform or improvement
examples: The educationist campaigned for increased funding in public schools
Leading educationists gathered to discuss future curriculum changes

definitions: person who provides instruction or education to others
examples: The educator prepared engaging lesson plans for her students
Experienced educators mentored the new teaching staff members

definitions: media content designed to educate through entertaining formats
examples: The museum's edutainment program made science fun for children
Television networks developed edutainment shows for preschool audiences

definitions: snake-like fish with smooth skin living in water
examples: The chef prepared grilled eel with teriyaki sauce
Electric eels generate powerful shocks to stun their prey

definitions: change that results when something is done or happens
impression produced on someone's mind or feelings
examples: The new policy had an immediate effect on productivity
Climate change effects are visible in melting polar ice
The lighting created a dramatic effect on stage
Her words had a calming effect on the crowd

definitions: power to produce desired results or intended effects successfully
examples: Clinical trials confirmed the efficacy of the new vaccine
Researchers questioned the efficacy of traditional teaching methods

definitions: ability to accomplish something with minimum waste of time and resources
examples: The factory improved efficiency by automating production processes
Energy efficiency standards reduced household electricity consumption significantly

definitions: sculpture or model of a person, often made for symbolic purposes
examples: Protesters burned an effigy of the corrupt politician
The ancient tomb contained stone effigies of noble warriors

definitions: liquid waste or sewage discharged into water bodies
examples: The factory's effluent polluted the nearby river system
Treatment plants process effluent before releasing it downstream

definitions: physical or mental energy needed to do something
organized attempt to achieve a particular goal
examples: She put considerable effort into learning the new language
The marathon required tremendous physical effort to complete
The conservation effort saved the endangered species from extinction
International efforts to combat climate change intensified recently

definitions: escape of fluid into body cavity or tissues
unrestrained expression of feelings in speech or writing
examples: The doctor drained the pleural effusion from his chest
Pericardial effusion can compress the heart and affect function
Her effusion of gratitude embarrassed the modest helper
The poet's effusion captured raw emotions after loss

definitions: person who believes in human equality especially regarding social and political rights
examples: The egalitarian philosopher argued for universal basic income
Egalitarians oppose systems that create social hierarchies unnecessarily

definitions: belief that all people deserve equal rights and opportunities
examples: Nordic countries practice egalitarianism through progressive taxation policies
The movement promoted egalitarianism in workplace hiring practices

definitions: oval reproductive body produced by female birds and animals
chicken egg used as food in cooking
examples: The robin laid three blue eggs in her nest
Sea turtle eggs incubate in warm beach sand
She scrambled two eggs for breakfast this morning
The recipe requires three eggs and two cups flour

definitions: large purple fruit used as vegetable in cooking
examples: She grilled eggplant slices with olive oil and herbs
The recipe called for two medium eggplants diced small

definitions: hard outer covering that protects an egg's contents
examples: The artist painted delicate designs on empty eggshells
Crushed eggshells provide calcium for garden soil improvement

definitions: person's sense of self-worth or self-importance
conscious thinking part of personality in psychoanalytic theory
examples: His enormous ego made collaboration with others difficult
The criticism bruised her fragile ego considerably
According to Freud, the ego mediates between id and superego
The ego develops during early childhood through experiences

definitions: person who thinks only of themselves without considering others
examples: The egocentric celebrity ignored fans requesting autographs politely
Her egocentric behavior alienated potential friends and colleagues

definitions: ethical theory that self-interest is the foundation of morality
examples: Ethical egoism suggests people should act in self-interest
His egoism prevented him from considering others' needs

definitions: long-legged wading bird with white plumage found near water
examples: The great egret stood motionless waiting for fish
Snowy egrets nest in colonies along coastal marshlands

definitions: cardinal number between seven and nine represented as 8
examples: The octopus has eight tentacles for catching prey
She worked eight hours at the office yesterday

definitions: cardinal number equal to seventeen plus one represented as 18
examples: Students can vote when they turn eighteen years old
The golf course has eighteen challenging holes to play

definitions: number eighteen in a sequence or order of things
examples: The eighteenth century brought significant scientific discoveries worldwide
She finished eighteenth in the marathon race today

definitions: number eight in a sequence or order of things
one of eight equal parts of something whole
examples: She finished eighth in the swimming competition finals
The eighth grade students prepared for graduation ceremony
Cut the pizza into eighths for equal serving sizes
An eighth note lasts half as long as quarter

definitions: number eighty in a sequence or order of things
examples: They celebrated grandmother's eightieth birthday with family gathering
The eightieth anniversary commemoration attracted thousands of visitors

definitions: cardinal number equal to eight times ten represented as 80
examples: The temperature reached eighty degrees Fahrenheit today outside
She lived to be eighty years old and healthy

definitions: discharge of semen from male reproductive organs during orgasm
sudden short exclamation or verbal outburst
examples: Premature ejaculation affects many men's sexual relationships significantly
The medical textbook explained ejaculation physiology in detail
His ejaculation of surprise startled everyone in attendance
The character's ejaculations punctuated the dramatic dialogue throughout

definitions: act of forcing someone or something out from a place
examples: The pilot's emergency ejection saved his life successfully
Security handled the troublemaker's ejection from the stadium

definitions: device that forces something out from a confined space
examples: The fighter jet's ejector seat malfunctioned during testing
The shell ejector removed spent cartridges from the rifle

definitions: process of developing something in detail from simple form
examples: The architect's elaboration transformed sketches into detailed blueprints
Further elaboration of her theory required additional research

definitions: enthusiastic and confident style or manner of doing things
examples: She performed the dance routine with remarkable elan
The team played with elan despite being behind

definitions: material or fabric that can stretch and return to shape
examples: The waistband contained elastic for comfortable fit adjustment
She used elastic bands to secure her hair

definitions: ability of material to return to original shape after stretching
degree to which demand or supply responds to price changes
examples: Rubber's elasticity makes it ideal for tire manufacturing
Scientists tested the elasticity of synthetic polymer materials
Price elasticity determines how consumers respond to increases
The elasticity of demand varies across different product categories

definitions: joint between upper arm and forearm in humans
sharp bend in pipe or other tubular structure
examples: She injured her elbow playing tennis last weekend
He rested his elbows on the table while reading
The plumber installed an elbow to redirect water flow
The exhaust pipe needed a ninety-degree elbow fitting

definitions: person of greater age especially within family or community
small tree or shrub with white flowers and dark berries
examples: The village elders made important community decisions together
She cared for her elderly parents with dedication
The elder tree bloomed with fragrant white flowers
They made elderberry wine from the elder berries

definitions: people who are old or aging, typically over sixty-five
examples: The elderly residents received priority vaccination appointments first
Community programs support elderly citizens living alone independently

definitions: first-born or oldest child in a family group
examples: The eldest son inherited the family business traditionally
As the eldest, she helped raise her younger siblings

definitions: legendary place of great wealth and opportunity sought by explorers
examples: Conquistadors searched for El Dorado in South America
Silicon Valley became an eldorado for tech entrepreneurs

definitions: people chosen or singled out as special or privileged
examples: Only the elect were invited to the exclusive gathering
The president-elect prepared for the upcoming inauguration ceremony

definitions: formal process of choosing person for political office by voting
examples: The presidential election occurs every four years nationally
Local elections determined the new city council members

definitions: course or subject that students can choose to study
examples: She chose photography as her elective this semester
The curriculum required two electives beyond core subjects

definitions: person who has the right to vote in an election
examples: Electoral college electors cast votes for the president
Registered electors received voting information by mail recently

definitions: all people in a country or area entitled to vote
examples: The electorate expressed dissatisfaction with current economic policies
Politicians campaigned to win the electorate's support nationwide

definitions: skilled person who installs and maintains electrical systems and equipment
examples: The electrician rewired the old house for safety
Licensed electricians must complete extensive apprenticeship training programs

definitions: form of energy from charged particles used for power and light
examples: The storm knocked out electricity for thousands of homes
Solar panels generate electricity from sunlight during daytime

definitions: process of providing electrical power to area or system
examples: Rural electrification brought modern conveniences to remote villages
Railway electrification reduced dependence on diesel fuel significantly

definitions: death or severe injury caused by electric shock or current
examples: The faulty wiring caused accidental electrocution of workers
Safety measures prevent electrocution in electrical maintenance work

definitions: conductor through which electricity enters or leaves an object or substance
examples: The technician attached electrodes to monitor heart activity
Battery electrodes facilitate the flow of electrical current

definitions: substance that produces electrically conducting solution when dissolved in water
examples: Athletes drink electrolyte solutions to replace lost minerals
Battery electrolytes enable the flow of electrical charge
